body.p: Innate immunity describes immunity that is non-specific to the pathogen or invading organism. Which of the following mechanisms are ALL considered innate immunity?

multiple_choice.choice: Antibody production, fever, anatomical barriers, the inflammatory process
Sequestering of pathogens, anatomical barriers, phagocytosis
Fever, the inflammatory reaction, antibody production

feedback.p: Incorrect. Antibody production is part of the acquired immune response.
Incorrect. Pathogen sequestration may occur as part of either the innate or adaptive responses.
Incorrect. Antibody production is an adaptive response.
Correct. All of these processes are innate mechanisms in addition to anatomic barriers.

body.p: The innate mechanisms of immunity are functional in the body as long as the body maintains a relative level of homeostasis. Which disruption of homeostasis would most likely have the greatest impact on the innate immune responses?

multiple_choice.choice: Chemotherapy prevents the cell division of cells in the mucous membranes.
Hemorrhage resulting in a low blood volume.
Diabetes with exceptionally high blood glucose levels.

feedback.p: Correct. Physical and chemical barriers provided by the mucous membranes are the first line of innate immune responses.
Incorrect. A low blood volume would impede movement of cells within the body but would not necessarily disrupt the innate immune response.
Incorrect. Hypothermia would slow down many chemical reactions within the body, and the shivering would use up energy reserves, but the innate response would still function.
Incorrect. High blood glucose levels are damaging to many of the cells, tissues and organs in the body, but they would not have a specific impact on the innate immune responses.
